active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the pros and cons of application-level encryption versus transport-level encryption (e.g., TLS) for protecting sensitive user data in a messaging app. Consider scenarios where one fails and the other succeeds, referencing data states and NIST guidelines. Synthesize group consensus on when to use each.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Application-Level Encryption (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Cryptographic Solutions > Cryptographic Implementation > Data Protection Implementation > Application-Level Encryption). **Research Context (Complete Summary):** Application-level encryption protects data at the app layer (e.g., E2EE messaging like Signal, field-level DB encryption), distinct from transport-level (TLS channel protection). Core: Encryption (plaintext to ciphertext via key), decryption, keys, cipher suites (key exchange/auth/encrypt/MAC algos), hashing (integrity, one-way). Data states: At rest (DB/files/backups; app encrypts fields/volumes), in transit (app E2EE beyond TLS), in use (memory; homomorphic/confidential computing). Data classification: Public/confidential/highly confidential. NIST SP 800-57: Part 1 (intro), Part 2 (key mgmt basics: gen/dist/rot/store/destroy), Part 3 (app-specific guidance: transport protocols (TLS/IPsec), wireless, key wrapping/derivation; extensible to apps). Best practices: Use libs (OpenSSL/libsodium), HSMs, rotate keys. Sources: NIST SP 800-57 Parts 1-3 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/Legacy/SP/nistspecialpublication800-57p3.pdf), OWASP Crypto Cheat Sheet (https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Cryptographic_Storage_Cheat_Sheet.html), SP 800-175B (Guideline for Using Cryptographic Standards). **Pedagogy Integration:** Use provided Learning Objectives (Bloom's: Remember/Understand/Apply/Analyze/Evaluate/Create), Active Learning (discussion/peer/problem-solving), Scaffolding (4 layers: Foundation/Components/Implementation/Integration). Prior knowledge: Link to symmetric/asymmetric, keys, hashing. **Generate Flashcards:** Follow Flashcard Schema exactly. Output JSON array of objects: [{'type': 'basic|mcq|cloze', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffold_layer': '1-4', 'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'source': '...'}]. Ensure 40-60 cards, balanced coverage, accurate/complete (no truncation), distractors per protocol. Promote active recall, critical thinking.
